intro: Monoptilon bellidiforme, commonly known as the bellidiform wildflower, is a small perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often colorful flowers. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often reddish in color. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks.
